item.description: (v.) to stay away from doing something by one’s own choice
(v.) to seize by authority; to take and keep
(v.) to force, compel; to restrain, hold back

(v.) to send off or out for a purpose;
(n.) an official message; promptness, speed
(adj.) causing uneasiness or worry
(adj., part.) suffering severely from hunger or from a lack of something
(v.) to look at or think about with great intensity and satisfaction; to take great personal joy in
(n.) the striking of one object against another; the shock caused by a collision
(adj.) impossible to understand
(adj.) beyond question or argument, definitely true
(adj.) totally without skill or appropriateness
(adj.) of immeasurable worth or importance
(v.) to free from domination; to release
(v.) to handle or use skillfully; to manage or control for personal gain or advantage
(adj.) greedy; very hungry or eager for satisfaction
(n.) a copy, close reproduction
(adv.) harsh, shrill; unpleasant sounding
(adj.) subject to change; not assured
(adv.) making no mistakes, faultless, completely accurate
(adj.) difficult to control; resistant to authority
(adj.) friendly, good-natured
(adj.) rough and noisy in a cheerful way, high-spirited
(n.) a series of notes clarifying or explaining something; an expression of opinion
(n.) to consult, talk over, exchange opinions; to present as a gift, favor, or honor
(v.) to cut apart in preparation for scientific study; to analyze with great care
(v.) to plunge into a liquid, drench; to put out quickly, extinguish
(adj.) pertaining to the origin or development of something
(adj.) good-humored, in high spirits, merry

(n.) a person who does imitations;
(v.) to imitate; to make fun of

(n.) a being that must eventually die;
(adj.) of or relating to a being that must eventually die; causing death, fatal
(adj.) quick and skillful in movement, agile; clever
(n.) a reading in public of something that is memorized; a memorized poem or piece of prose that is read aloud
(adj.) answering or replying, reacting readily to requests, suggestions, etc.; showing interest and understanding

(v.) to search through, investigate the contents of;
(n.) an active search; a collection of odd items
(adj.) having a smooth, glossy, well-groomed surface or appearance
(n.) the strength needed to keep going or overcome physical or mental strain, staying power
(n.) a quality or characteristic (especially of personality), a distinguishing feature
(adj.) possessing or acting with bravery or boldness

(n.) a solemn or sacred promise or pledge;
(v.) to declare or promise in a solemn way
(v.) to make twisting or turning movements in a way that suggests pain or struggle
(v.) to stick to, remain attached; to be devoted or loyal as a follower or supporter
(adj.) persistent, stubbornly determined, refusing to give up

(n.) a meeting (especially one that is unplanned); a meeting of enemies, battle;
(v.) to meet or come upon

(n.) a long narrative poem (or other literary composition) about the deeds of heroes; an event or movement of great sweep;
(adj.) on a grand scale, vast
(adj.) dizzy, light-headed; lacking seriousness
(adj.) easily fooled, tricked, or cheated
(adj.) too great to be counted; unpredictable, uncertain

(adj.) having lost the power of feeling or movement;
(v.) to dull the feelings of; to cause to lose feeling

(n.) a small hole made by a sharp object;
(v.) to make a small hole with a sharp object, pierce
(n.) deep and painful regret for one’s past misdeeds; pangs of conscience
(v.) to find and bring back, get back; to put right, make good
(adj.) embarrassed, or meek, or timid
(n.) a detective
(adj.) overly self-satisfied, self-righteous

(n.) a person or thing that acts in place of another;
(v.) to put (someone or something) in place of another
(adj.) of enormous size, strength, power, or scope
(adj.) unrefined, crude; awkward or clumsy
(adj.) dishonest; not guided or controlled by moral principles
(n.) a sudden, violent upward movement; great disorder or radical change
(adj.) full of melancholy yearning or longing, sad, pensive

(v.) to talk or act in a noisy and threatening way; to blow in stormy gusts;
(n.) speech that is loud and threatening
(adj.) having to do with the sky or heavens, heavenly; yielding great bliss or happiness
(v.) to preserve; to keep from being damaged, lost, or wasted, to save
(adj.) easily noticeable, attracting attention
(n.) a single aspect of a specific thing; a measurement of something in one direction, such as length, width, or height
(adj.) fair-minded, free from selfish motives; indifferent
(v.) to swallow up, overwhelm, consume
(adj.) strained or improbable (in the sense of not being logical or believable), going far afield from a topic
(adj.) of, relating to, or involving the entire world; comprehensive
(v.) to plunge or dip into a fluid; to involve deeply

(n.) something that causes surprise or astonishment;
(v.) to feel surprise or astonishment

(n.) a sharp spasm of pain; a sharp feeling of mental or emotional distress;
(v.) to cause to feel sharp spasms of pain or distress
(n.) a wide, unobstructed view of an area; a complete survey of a subject

(n.) a humorous or ridiculous imitation;
(v.) to make fun of something by imitating it
(v.) to roam about stealthily in search of something

(n.) enjoyment or satisfaction; something that adds a pleasing flavor;
(v.) to enjoy greatly
(adj.) done in a way so as not to be seen or observed; sneaky, underhanded
(n.) a pattern, typically in the form of metal, wood, or plastic; something that is used as a model to imitate
(n.) the landscape, especially its physical features or fitness for some use; a field of knowledge
(v.) to grow vigorously; to grow in wealth and possessions
(v.) to get revenge for, get even for, settle a score; to punish someone or get satisfaction for a wrong or injury
(v.) to discourage, scare off, or prevent through fear or doubt

(v.) to defeat; to keep from gaining some end;
(n.) a light fencing sword; a person or thing serving as a contrast to another

(v.) to meet in accordance with a plan;
(n.) a meeting by agreement; a meeting place

(n.) an action taken to destroy something or to prevent it from working properly;
(v.) to take action to destroy something or to prevent it from working properly

(n.) a string of wire, hair, etc.; a beach or shore;
(v.) to leave in a hopeless position; to drive or run aground

(v.) to walk slowly, stroll;
(n.) an easy pace; a leisurely walk
(v.) to think, believe; to consider, have an opinion

(v.) to set aside for a special purpose; to mark an animal’s ear for identification;
(n.) an identifying mark or feature
(n.) any trade, profession, or occupation; a sense of fitness or special calling for one’s work
(adj.) not movable; not moving

(adj.) living forever; never to be forgotten;
(n.) one that will live forever
(adj.) blocked so that nothing can go through
(adj.) not influenced or controlled by others
(adj.) not capable of being seen
(adj.) sure to happen, unavoidable

(n.) a rapid, large-scale outpouring of something
(adj.) marked by bloodshed, slaughter, or violence
(n.) a feeling of fear, doubt, or uncertainty
(v.) to meet face-to-face, especially as a challenge; to come to grips with
(v.) to make timid or frighten by threats; to use fear to get someone to do (or not to do) something
(v.) to bring before a court of law for trial; to carry out
(v.) to declare to be true, state positively; to confirm

(v.) to throw doubt upon, cause to be distrusted; to damage in reputation;
(v.) a loss or lack of belief, confidence, or reputation

(v.) to draw a line under; to put special emphasis on;
(n.) a line drawn under something
(v.) to make high in rank, power, character, or quality; to praise, honor
(v.) to give a false or untrue idea
(adj.) without legal force or effect; no longer binding
(n.) bitter disagreement; fighting, struggle
(v.) to move upward

(n.) a steep, narrow waterfall; something falling or rushing forth in quantity;
(v.) to flow downward (like a waterfall)
(v.) to encircle, to enclose, or to include
(v.) to go or move backward; to become more distant

(v.) to have a heavy, violent, swelling motion (like waves);
(n.) a powerful forward rush
(v.) to fall forward; to overturn, bring about the downfall of
(v.) to keep doing something in spite of difficulties; to refuse to quit even when the going is tough
(v.) to tear to pieces; split violently apart
(v.) to feel sorry for what one has done or has failed to do
(v.) to clean or polish by hard rubbing; to examine with great care or to move about quickly in search of

(n.) very fine sand or gravel; courage in the face of hardship or danger;
(v.) to grind; to make a grating sound
(n.) one who expects things to turn out for the best; someone who looks on the bright side of things
(adj.) able to deal promptly and effectively with all sorts of problems; clever in finding ways and means of getting along

(adj.) wise;
(n.) a very wise person
(adj.) peaceful, free of emotional upset, clear and free of storm; majestic
(adj.) healthy, morally and socially sound and good; helping to bring about or preserve good health
(v.) to fool, deceive; to mislead utterly
(v.) to take away from; reduce in value or reputation

(adj.) flexible;
(v.) to cause to become flexible
(v.) to prove incorrect
(n.) information; facts, figures, statistics
(v.) to count; to name one by one, list

(n.) something that influences or affects a result; (Mathematics) any of the numbers that when multiplied together form a product;
(v.) to consider something while making a decision or judgment

(v.) to count up, to keep score; to make entries for reckoning or to correspond or agree;
(n.) a total or score

(adj.) likely to undergo change; changeable;
(n.) a value or quantity that varies; a symbol for such
(n.) quickness of movement
(adj.) willing to do what someone else wants; obedient
(n.) good judgment; care in speech and action or freedom to judge or choose

(n.) one who is against war or the use of violence;
(adj.) opposing war or violence
(adj.) humbly obedient; tending to give in to authority, obeying without protest
(adj.) willful, stubborn
(adj.) marked by strong emotion, especially pity and sorrow; woefully inadequate or lacking
(n.) one who believes or expects the worst; prophet of doom
(adj.) unimportant, trivial; narrow-minded
(adj.) selfishly ambitious
(adj.) appearing evil or dangerous; threatening evil or harm

(n.) a trial performance to demonstrate one's talent;
(v.) to take part in a trial performance to demonstrate one's talent; to hold such an event
(v.) to waste time, to be idle; to spend more time in doing something than is necessary

(v.) to stroll; walk in an easy, leisurely way;
(n.) a stroll
(n.) one whose job it is to assign work to others; one who uses his or her power to make people work very hard

(v.) to stop short and refuse to go on; to prevent from happening;
(n.) (in baseball) an illegal motion made by a pitcher

(v.) to indicate, point out; to appoint;
(adj.) selected but not yet installed
(v.) to keep within set limits; to confine
(v.) to give power or authority to; to enable, to permit
(v.) to stimulate, spur; to give support to, foster
(v.) to provide with a reason for doing; to push on to some goal
(adj.) profitable; bringing in money or some special advantage
(adj.) resembling a meteor in speed; having sudden and temporary brilliance similar to a meteor’s
(adj.) not enough; barely enough
(v.) to save, be thrifty; to be extremely sparing with

(v.) to change something that is incorrect or inadequate;
(n.) the change of something that is incorrect or inadequate
(v.) to pay back; to give payment for
(v.) to fill again, make good, replace

(v.) to move from one place, person, or thing to another;
(n.) the act of moving from one place, person, or thing to another
(v.) to change completely in appearance or form; to make into something else
(v.) to express spoken or written words in a different language; to explain in simpler terms
(adj.) extremely dry; uninteresting, dull
(n.) a light or other signal that warns and guides, a lighthouse; anything that guides or inspires

(n.) a disease that causes plants to wither and die; a condition of disease or ruin;

(n.) a great flood, a heavy rain; anything that comes in vast quantity;

(n.) one aspect or side of a subject or problem; one of the cut surfaces of a gem

(adj.) coarse, vulgar; very noticeable, total;
(v.) to earn

(adj.) important or valuable enough to spend time or effort on
(n.) something kept in memory of the giver; a souvenir

(v.) to recall one’s past thoughts, feelings, or experiences
(adj.,) adv.) in advance; at an earlier time

(adj.) of enduring quality or interest; in line with established principles or standards;
(n.) a perfect, definitive, or timeless example of a particular style

(adj.) belonging to the same period of time as oneself;
(n.) a person of the same time
(n.) the beginning, start (especially of something violent and destructive); an attack, assault
(adj.) coming after; following in time, place, or order

(n.) the point at which something begins or happens; a border;

(v.) to satisfy, relieve, or bring to an end
(adj.) tightly drawn, tense; neat, in good order

(n.) a delicate color or hue; a slight trace of something;
